images.copyright: Sperm whale mother and albino baby swimming off the coast of Portugal (© Flip Nicklin/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Celebrating a whale of a tale
images.caption: Celebrating a whale of a tale
images.desc: A sperm whale surfaces in the North Atlantic as her young albino calf swims beside her. It's a rare photo opportunity as these majestic creatures spend much of their time deep down, over 1,000ft below the waves. On this day in 1841, a young Herman Melville set out from New Bedford, Massachusetts, USA, on a whaling voyage to the South Pacific which would help inspire his masterwork Moby-Dick. The day is celebrated at the New Bedford Whaling Museum with an annual marathon public reading of the novel - an event that lasts 25 hours.
images.bsTitle: Celebrating a whale of a tale

images.copyright: Field of Light at Sensorio, by Bruce Munro, Paso Robles, California, USA (© George Rose/Getty Images)
images.title: Solar-powered light show
images.caption: A solar-powered light spectacular
images.desc: Artist Bruce Munro was camping at Uluru (the Australian monolith formerly known as Ayers Rock) with his family in 1992 when he envisioned the art installation on today's homepage. Called Field of Light, it's on display at an arts venue called Sensorio in Paso Robles in the US state of California, the latest stop in a tour of sites around the world. Visitors will find 58,800 solar-powered spheres, lit by optical fibres that change colour.

images.copyright: The whirlpool in Myllykoski scenic area at winter in Oulanka National Park, Kuusamo, Finland (© Lassi Rautiainen/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Winter in the Finnish wilds
images.caption: Winter in the Finnish wilds
images.desc: This frozen scene might be a picture of tranquility right now but once the snow melts in northern Finland's Oulanka National Park, this gentle swirl will turn into deafening rapids, hosting rafters and waterfall-seekers. But there's plenty of time to enjoy the winter calm, as the region's wintery cold regularly stretches into April or May. The partly frozen whirlpool churns near Myllykoski, a defunct mill which is now a resting point along Finland's busiest nature trail, Karhunkierros. The 50-mile route begins more than 500 miles north of Helsinki, with midsummer hikers enjoying treks lit by the midnight sun. For determined skiers and intrepid types in snowshoes, portions of the trail remain open through the freezing winter. Not feeling it? Chill at home instead with a hot drink and enjoy this wintery scene from afar.

images.copyright: Sunrise at Mount Fuji, Japan (© Juan Paulo Gutierrez/Getty Images)
images.title: A sunrise like no other
images.caption: A sunrise like no other
images.desc: What a beautiful view to welcome in the new year! Today’s serene scene is Mount Fuji, long a destination for pilgrims, poets and artists. Often pictured capped in snow, the volcano is also Japan's highest peak at 3,776m (12,388ft) and is a registered Unesco World Heritage site.

og.title: A sunrise like no other
og.desc: What a beautiful view to welcome in the new year! Today’s serene scene is Mount Fuji, long a destination for pilgrims, poets and artists…

images.copyright: Fireworks for New Year's Eve in Backnang, Germany (© Lilly/Alamy)
images.title: 3, 2, 1 … Happy New Year!
images.caption: 3, 2, 1 … Happy New Year!
images.desc: Backnang, the town celebrating the new year in this photo, is in Germany's Baden region. Thanks to the Rhine River on the west and the Black Forest to the east, the soil in Baden is ideal for vineyards. Among the varieties of wine produced here, Spätburgunder is common, which you may know by its French name: Pinot Noir. The people of Backnang may well be celebrating with a glass of Pinot or something else this evening. But however you choose to celebrate, here's wishing you a very happy and healthy new year!

images.copyright: Saguaro cacti in the Sonoran Desert near Tucson, Arizona, USA (© Jack Dykinga/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Sky island views
images.caption: Sky island views
images.desc: December might be chilly here in the UK - but over in the US state of Arizona, the Sonoran Desert stays warm all year round. In this photo, we’re looking at a 'sky island' - an isolated woodland, high above sea level, surrounded by very different lowland environments. In this case, the desert land at the base of the mountain is peppered with saguaros, a stately cactus recognised by its long arms. The snow-capped Santa Catalina Mountains in the distance are part of the Madrean Sky Islands and are home to Mount Lemmon Sky Valley, the southernmost ski destination in the US. Mount Lemmon reaches 9,150ft at the summit and gets about 15ft of snow annually.

images.copyright: German ski jumper Markus Eisenbichler competing in the Four Hills Tournament, Innsbruck, Austria, on 3 January 2018 (© Daniel Karmann/picture alliance via Getty Images)
images.title: Helloooooo, Innsbruck
images.caption: Helloooooo, Innsbruck
images.copyrightonly: © Daniel Karmann/picture alliance via Getty Images
images.desc: We're featuring the Four Hills Tournament, a set of four ski jump events which starts today, with an image from the 2017/2018 competition. This annual event, which wraps up in early January, starts in the German towns of Oberstdorf and Garmisch-Partenkirchen and then moves to Austria, with events in Innsbruck (pictured here) and Bischofshofen.
